page.title: 04Methodist Chapel at Amble
page.content: The Methodist chapel at Amble was built in about 1840. There is also a {cemetery}on the road running South West from the village. In the past many local people attended and on{ {special occasions}its pews would have been full. Nowadays only 1 or 2 local inhabitants attend. The chapel is administered by the Methodist Church at Wadebridge.{One service}is held there every month. At Harvest, Christmas and Easter all the people from Wadebridge Methodist Church go to the chapel at Amble for a service with the Amble people. Even in summer with the village{population}increased by tourists few people attend the chapel. The{future}of the building is under discussion.Does its use justify the cost of its{maintenance?
